DOC.brief_summary: The is a pilot study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of hybrid transvaginal-transabdominal procedures. Diagnostic peritoneoscopy (visualizing the inside of the abdomen), appendectomy (removal of the appendix), and cholecystectomy (removal of the gallbladder) will be performed through a vaginal incision with an additional small incision in the umbilicus.
DOC.criteria: Chronic or early appendicitis Symptomatic gallstones Suspicious abdominal mass/nodule Female Age 1860 years ASA Class I or II Pregnant women History of previous abdominal, pelvic, or vaginal surgery History of previous abdominal or pelvic radiation therapy History of fibroid uterus History of endometriosis History of large ovarian cyst History of unexplained vaginal bleeding or dyspareunia
